0.rationale:
Think-through:
• We can’t go DOWN (would collide with our neck at (6, 1)).  
• LEFT → (5, 2) is safe but drifts from nearby apples.  
• RIGHT → (7, 2) is safe and gets us one move from the apple at (7, 3), but then we’re committed to east-west motion with the wall only 2 columns away.  
• UP → (6, 3) is safe, also puts us one move from the same apple, and keeps us centered so we can still pivot toward (5, 6) or straight up the board if we need to.

Central flexibility is worth more than the small positional gain of moving right first, so we’ll keep climbing.

Next-turn plan: from (6, 3) go RIGHT to eat (7, 3) unless something new blocks it; otherwise continue up toward (5, 6).

Decided move: UP
